conclusion: Consider principles of physics: power, collision, and deflection.
Car is initially on the right side moving towards the left; blocks scattered on green surface.
Car will collide with blocks causing them to move or be deflected.
Deflection and direction depend on force and mass of blocks.
Power of car is product of force and velocity; kinetic energy transferred to blocks.
Energy distribution depends on masses and nature of collisions.
Image 1: Car approaching blocks, not yet in contact.
Image 2: Car in contact with blocks, pushing or deflecting them; car slowed down.
Image 3: Car has moved further left, causing more deflection.
Car has moved significantly left, causing significant block deflection.
Car will continue moving and causing deflection until it stops or collides with another object.
Final position and state depend on total energy transferred and distribution among blocks.
Final answer: Car will move and deflect blocks until it stops due to resistance.
